questions.text: A 30 year old patient presented to the causality after a motor vehicle accident. He has bruises on the chest. His pulse is 100 bpm. BP is 125/85 and RR is 28. A chest Xray was performed and show below. What is the next most appropriate step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source.

options.label: B
options.text: Small blood vessels are most radioresistant

options.label: C
options.text: Rapidly proliferating cells are most radioresistant.

options.text: Small intestinal mucosa is most radioresistant.

questions.correct_answer: A. Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source.

A 45-year-old female who has to undergo radiotherapy for treatment of Ca Cervix stage 2b. Which of the following statement is true regarding ionizing radiation?

options.label: A
options.text: The normal cell and cancer cells will be equally sensitive

options.label: B
options.text: Gl mucosa is more resistant part

options.label: C
options.text: The radiation at a point is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source-coulomb law

options.label: D
options.text: Small blood vessels are resistant to the effect of radiation

questions.correct_answer: C. The radiation at a point is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source-coulomb law
